code.displayName: CHIEF COMPLAINT AND REASON FOR VISIT

list.item: Chest pain, radiating to left arm, 3 hours

tr.td: ORAL, Instructions: Once daily at bedtime

section.title: MEDICATIONS ADMINISTERED DURING VISIT
section.text: Data in this section may be excluded or not available.

tr.td: Perform Electrocardiogram (EKG) to assess heart activity.
Blood test for cardiac biomarkers (Troponin, CK-MB).
Prescribe Aspirin 81mg daily for antiplatelet therapy.
Prescribe Beta-Blocker (Metoprolol 25mg BID) to control heart rate.
Refer to cardiologist for further evaluation and stress test.
Schedule follow-up visit for medication effectiveness and symptom review.
Perform Echocardiogram to assess heart function.
Holter monitor for 24-hour cardiac rhythm assessment.
Cardiac rehabilitation enrollment for lifestyle modification.
Final review with cardiologist to assess progress.

The patient presented with chest pain, shortness of breath, and diaphoresis. Initial ECG showed ST-segment elevation, and cardiac biomarkers (Troponin) were elevated, indicating a high likelihood of Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS). Dr. Davis has advised continuous cardiac monitoring, immediate administration of antiplatelet therapy, and urgent referral to cardiology for further evaluation. The patient is advised to report to the emergency department immediately if symptoms worsen.
Monitor cholesterol levels and lipid profile
